feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 4:40AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increasing Snow Threats Sunday night Through Thursday... A front will usher in a period of wintery weather conditions for most of the Interior beginning Sunday night. This first initial front will bring widespread snowfall with a general range of 2 to 4 inches possible, locally heavier amounts to the west of Fairbanks of 4 to 7 inches, through Tuesday. A second storm
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 4:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Two Impactful Winter Storms Sunday Through Thursday... Two consecutive winter storms are expected to impact the West Coast and Western Interior starting on Sunday and could bring a combination of winter impacts including heavy snow, strong winds, and the potential for elevated water levels with storm surge along the coast.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 10 at 8:43AM EST until November 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The river is forecast to remain in Minor Flood Stage today before beginning to slowly fall through Action Stage early Saturday morning. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 9:03AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THERE IS AN INCREASED FIRE THREAT TODAY DUE TO DRY CONDITIONS... Westerly winds of 10 to 15 MPH are expected this afternoon in addition to low relative humidity values. These conditions, combined with drier vegetation, will result in elevated fire danger. Any fires that start could spread quickly. Due to these conditions, outdoor burning is not recommended.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 3:24AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Enhanced Fire Danger this Afternoon... The combination of a very dry atmosphere, low fuel moisture and a light breeze will result in an enhanced fire danger this afternoon. Consider burning on a different day. Be sure camp fires are completely extinguished.
